17:
Flood Adaptation Implementation Survey
Consent Form



You have been chosen to participate in a research survey about flood risk and mitigation options being conducted by Professor Y. C. Ethan Yang from Lehigh University. The purpose of the study is to gather information about residents’ perceptions of flooding risk, and preferences for flood adaptation options (e.g., buying flood insurance, making home improvements, and relocation) that can be used to reduce potential flood losses. Your participation in the study will involve answering about 50 questions (including sub-questions) regarding your opinions about flooding. The estimated time to finish the survey is about 20 minutes.



There are no costs to you for participating nor do we anticipate any risks to you from participating in this study. The information you provide will help us understand the best way to integrate residents’ opinions into our computer models of flood risk. You will be compensated with the amount you agreed upon with Prolific before you entered the survey.



This survey is anonymous. Any data or answers to questions will remain confidential regarding your identity. Any information collected through this research project that personally identifies you will not be voluntarily released or disclosed without your separate consent, except as specifically required by law. Your decision whether to participate is voluntary. You may skip any questions that you are not comfortable answering and are free to withdraw from this survey at any time without jeopardizing your relationship with Lehigh University. If you have any questions about this study and want to know more, you may call Professor Y. C. Ethan Yang at (610) 758-5685. You may report problems that may result from your participation or direct questions regarding your rights as a subject in this study to Lehigh University’s Office of Research Integrity at (610) 758-2871 or inirb@lehigh.edu. All reports or correspondence will be kept confidential. You can print a hard copy of this form as a record or contact Professor Y. C. Ethan Yang for a hard copy.



To confirm that you have read and understood the foregoing information, that you have received answers to any questions you may have, and you consent to participate in the study, please select “Yes” below.

72:
22. The following questions relate to flood insurance, relocation plans/ buyout programs, and house elevation.

Please indicate how well you agree with the following statements.



Note: A buyout program is a government initiative that offers grants to purchase properties and eligible vacant lands in flood-prone communities at pre-disaster values. Its goal is to reduce flood risks and prevent future losses by removing properties from high-risk areas. House elevation involves raising house structures above flood levels to minimize flood losses. Flood insurance is a federally supported program that allows policyholders to pay a monthly premium and receive full coverage for financial losses in the event of a flood. - 1. Relocation plans/buyout programs can help me significantly minimize property losses caused by floods.
